rule1.name: Invalid Attribute value for null
rule1.message: Invalid 'null' value, please provide value as either 'not collected', 'not applicable' or 'missing'.

rule2.name: Invalid Attribute value for controlled terms
rule2.message: Attribute value is not in controlled terms.

rule3.name: Duplicated sample title in this submission
rule3.message: Sample title is duplicated in the submission.

rule4.name: Taxonomy name and id not match
rule4.message: Organism and taxonomy id do not match.

rule5.name: Invalid BioProject accession
rule5.message: Invalid BioProject accession. Please provide a valid BioProject accession with format PRJ[D|E|N]xxxxxx or PSUBxxxxxx

rule6.name: BioProject not found
rule6.message: BioProject accession is not registered in your account. Please provide a valid BioProject accession.

rule8.name: Invalid country
rule8.message: Entered country is not in controlled terms.

rule11.name: Invalid publication identifier
rule11.message: Invalid publication identifier, enter pubmed id, DOI or URL.

rule24.name: Identical Attributes
rule24.message: You should have one BioSample for each specimen, and each of your BioSamples must have differentiating information (excluding sample name, title, bioproject accession and description). This check was implemented to encourage submitters to include distinguishing information in their samples. If the distinguishing information is in the sample name, title or description, please recode it into an appropriate attribute, either one of the predefined attributes or a custom attribute you define. If it is necessary to represent true biological replicates as separate BioSamples, you might add an 'aliquot' or 'replicate' attribute, e.g., 'replicate = biological replicate 1', as appropriate. Note that multiple assay types, e.g., RNA-seq and ChIP-seq data may reference the same BioSample if appropriate.

rule27.name: Missing mandatory Attribute
rule27.message: Sample has missing mandatory attribute(s). If you do not have information for the required field(s), please provide value as either 'not collected', 'not applicable' or 'missing'.

rule28.name: Duplicate Sample Names
rule28.message: The following Sample Names were used in submission more than one time. Please provide unique Sample Names.

rule30.name: Non-ASCII header line
rule30.message: Unable to parse file: the header line contains non-ASCII characters. Please check that uploaded file is in text format, not Excel.

rule36.name: Missing group of at least one required Attributes
rule36.message: Sample has missing attribute(s), at least one of the following attributes is required. If you do not have information for the required field(s), please provide value as either 'not collected', 'not applicable' or 'missing'.

rule40.name: Future collection date
rule40.message: Sample collection date is a future date, please specify a date from the past.

rule41.name: Latlon versus country
rule41.message: Values provided for 'latitude and longitude' and 'geographic location' contradict each other.

rule45.name: Taxonomy error warning
rule45.message: Submission processing may be delayed due to necessary curator review. Please check spelling of organism, current information generated the following error message and will require a taxonomy consult.

rule48.name: Package versus Organism
rule48.message: Organism is inappropriate for package. Please either specify a different sample type package or edit the organism according to the 'Appropriate organism and package' rules described at

rule58.name: Non-ASCII Attribute value
rule58.message: Non-ASCII format characters detected. Please check for non-standard characters in your attribute values and reformat as ASCII-only so that data can be properly consumed by dependent databases.

rule61.name: Multiple Attribute values
rule61.message: Multiple values detected. Only one value is allowed. First value was used for subsequent validation.

rule62.name: Multiple vouchers
rule62.message: Multiple voucher attributes (specimen voucher, culture collection or biologic material) detected with the same institution code. Only one value is allowed.

rule69.name: Warning about BioProject increment
rule69.message: Consecutive BioProjects are referenced in this submission. This is often a mistake caused by incrementing autofill in Excel, please check your file.

rule70.name: Invalid BioProject type
rule70.message: BioProject is an Umbrella project, not a primary data type of BioProject. Please provide the accession of the correct primary data BioProject or create a new BioProject, if necessary.

rule73.name: Redundant taxonomy attributes
rule73.message: Redundant values are detected in at least two of the following fields: organism; host; isolation source. For example, the value you supply for 'host' should not be identical to the value supplied for 'isolation source'. This check is case-insensitive and ignores white-space.

rule74.name: package_vs_organism > Pathogen: clinical or host-associated
rule74.message: Must have lineage Bacteria, Viruses or Fungi, to species-level

rule75.name: package_vs_organism > Pathogen: environmental/food/other
rule75.message: Must have lineage Bacteria, Viruses or Fungi, to species-level

rule76.name: package_vs_organism > Microbe
rule76.message: Must have lineage Bacteria, Archaea, Viruses, Viroids or Fungi; or for unicellular eukaryotes, Must not have lineage Metazoa, Embryophyta, unclassified sequences or other sequences

rule77.name: package_vs_organism > Model organism or animal
rule77.message: Must NOT be Homo sapiens or have lineage Bacteria, Archaea, Viruses, Fungi, Viroids, unclassified sequences or other sequence

rule78.name: package_vs_organism > Metagenome or environmental
rule78.message: Must be a metagenome, where lineage starts with unclassified sequences and scientific name ends with 'metagenome'

rule81.name: package_vs_organism > Plant
rule81.message: Must have lineage Viridiplantae, or be known to have plastids

rule83.name: package_vs_organism > MIMS Environmental/Metagenome
rule83.message: Must be a metagenome, where lineage starts with unclassified sequences and scientific name ends with 'metagenome'

rule84.name: package_vs_organism > MIGS Cultured Bacterial/Archaeal
rule84.message: Must have lineage Bacteria or Archaea

rule88.name: package_vs_organism > MIMARKS Survey related
rule88.message: Must be a metagenome, where lineage starts with unclassified sequences and scientific name ends with 'metagenome'

rule92.name: Missing required attribute name
rule92.message: Required field is missing from the header line of the file.

rule95.name: BioProject submission id replacement
rule95.message: BioProject submission id (PSUBxxxxxx) is replaced to PRJD accession number.
